p: Without capacities, moving swabs and reagent would be equivalent. For example, a lab l 1 could send a swab it cannot test to another lab l 2, because l 1 does not have enough reagent to test it; or, which is the same, l 2 could send one unit of reagent to l 1, which could test their swab by themselves. In the presence of capacities determined by equipment and personnel availability, though, the two options are not interchangeable. In the example above, l 2 might not have the capacity to test one more swab, while l 1 could have it if provided with the necessary reagent.
